m_szDocSumamry: MSU Researchers Discover How Bacteria Can Clean Up Nuclear Waste & Generate Electricity September 8th, 2011 by Andrew   Photo Credit: Michigan State University A team of researchers at Michigan State University has solved the mystery of how Geobacter bacteria found in soils manage to clean up nuclear waste and generate electricity at the same time. Going a step further, the team genetically engineered a Geobacter strain that does an even better job of it.
